abstract: The bank already paid $2 billion in a 2013 settlement with the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, but did not meet all the obligations of that earlier settlement.
snippet: The bank already paid $2 billion in a 2013 settlement with the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, but did not meet all the obligations of that earlier settlement.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase will pay an additional $48 million to settle remaining issues stemming from missteps in its handling of mortgage servicing accounts after the 2008 financial crisis.

headline.main: JPMorgan Pays $48 Million More to Settle Mortgage Servicing Issues

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
